|Title=Know the definition of "classic" prolonged fever
|Description=≥38°C on several occasions, ≥3 weeks, without diag after appropriate investigations (3 days in hospital or 3 cs)
|Section=Definition
|Contributors=
|Order=1}}
Definition of "classic" prolonged fever '''([[Hyperthermia/fever SD-044|hyperthermia/fever]])'''''

* Occurrence in a subject with no particular medical condition (non-immunocompromised, not hospitalised)
* Temperature (taken at rest) ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions,
* For ≥ 3 weeks,
* No cause identified after appropriate investigations carried out during three days in hospital or after three consultations. There is no pre-established, definitive list of these investigations, which vary according to the clinical context of each patient.


Note: there is no pre-established, definitive list of appropriate investigations (which vary depending on the patient) before making the diagnosis of prolonged fever.

question.title: What is the definition of 'classic' prolonged fever?
question.description: A prolonged fever is defined as a fever that lasts for more than 3 weeks without a clear cause after appropriate investigations.

option_a.title: ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for more than 2 weeks without any underlying medical condition
option_a.description: A common misconception about the definition of classic prolonged fever

option_b.title: ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for more than 3 weeks without a clear cause after appropriate investigations
option_b.description: The correct definition of classic prolonged fever

option_c.title: ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for more than 3 weeks with a clear cause after appropriate investigations
option_c.description: A possible misunderstanding of the definition of classic prolonged fever

option_d.title: ≥ 38.3°C on several occasions for more than 3 weeks with no underlying medical condition
option_d.description: A plausible but incorrect definition of classic prolonged fever

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
